javan rhino
the remaining subspecies, the indonesian javan rhinocerous, has less than 70 javan rhinos alive today, all living in the ujung kulon national park, indonesia. it has a single horn plus folded skin resembling armour, weighing between 900 - 2,300 kg.
üì∑javan rhino @wwf https://t.co/nolxlfmf8q

sumatran rhino
the sumatran rhino weighs between 500 - 900 kg with long hair and is related to the extinct woolly rhino species. they're critically endangered animals, with less than 100 sumatran rhinos alive in borneo and sumatra.

üì∑ sumatran rhino by @wwf https://t.co/wj5ubvpfkt

greater one-horned rhino
greater one-horned rhinos found in india and nepal have one horn and weigh 1,800 - 2,500 kg. skin folds protect their neck, plus additional folds look like body armour.

üì∑ greater one-horned rhinos by @wwf https://t.co/gvyc3jpa0b

black rhino
the last three surviving black rhino subspecies are the eastern black rhino, southern central black rhino and south western black rhino. they weigh between 900 to 1,350 kg. namibia, kenya and south africa hold 87% of their population.

üì∑ black rhino by @kwskenya https://t.co/lhcqrtuwcg

white rhino
with square-shaped lips and weighing between 1,800 - 2,500 kg. white rhinos have two subspecies, the northern white rhino and the southern white rhino. the last two northern white rhinos, najin and fatu, live in @olpejeta in kenya.

üì∑ white rhino by @kwskenya https://t.co/jue6h1o9lt
